title: 40Hex Number 8
historical_context: This article is part of the 40Hex zine, which was known for its focus on virus creation and hacking culture during the early 1990s.
target_audience: Hackers, virus creators, security researchers, and those interested in early computer virus culture.
short_summary: This issue of 40Hex introduces Boot Sector Appreciation Month, discusses the community's reputation regarding early viruses, and announces the formation of a new Macintosh programming team focused on creating utilities and trojans.
summary: Additionally, 40Hex announces the formation of the PHALCON/SKISM Macintosh Programming Team, consisting of members Renegade, Sixo, Trojan, and Wintermute. This team aims to produce quality Macintosh utilities, trojans, and other intriguing projects, which will soon be available on various Bulletin Board Systems (BBS). The issue serves as a testament to the evolving landscape of computer viruses and the camaraderie within the hacking community, showcasing both the challenges and the creativity that define this era of digital exploration.
